Instance.description:
Tuning specific to a career gig. Contains the display information, the times which are valid for gigs, and the pay range of the gig.
Gigs are adhoc career events which gives the sim pay if they complete it.

TunableVariant.name: _display_data
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify display data for this instance.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The instance's display data.

TunableVariant.name: instance_display_description
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a display description for this instance.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The instance's description.

TunableVariant.name: instance_display_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a display icon for this instance.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The instance's icon.

TunableVariant.name: instance_display_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a display name for this instance.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The instance's name.

TunableVariant.name: additional_pay_per_overmax_level
TunableVariant.description: If checked, overmax levels will be considered when calculating pay for this gig. The actual implementation of this may vary by gig type.

TunableVariant.name: audio_on_prep_task_completion
TunableVariant.description: A sting to play at the time a prep task completes.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career this gig is associated with.

TunableList.name: career_events
TunableList.description: A list of available career events for this gig.

TunableVariant.name: critical_failure_test
TunableVariant.description: The tests for checking whether or not the Sim should receive the CRITICAL_FAILURE outcome. This will override other GigResult behavior.

TdescFragTag.name: enabled
TdescFragTag.description: The tests to be performed on the Sim (and any customer). If the tests pass, the outcome will be CRITICAL_FAILURE.

TunableVariant.name: disabled_tooltip
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, the tooltip when this row is disabled.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_demotion_text
TunableVariant.description: A string that, if enabled, will be pre-pended to the bullet list of results in the promotion notification. Tokens are: * 0 : The Sim owner of the career

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_dialog
TunableVariant.description: A results dialog to show. This dialog allows a list of icons with labels. Stats are added at the end of this icons.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: UI Dialog with a list of labeled icons.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an icon to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

Tunable.name: is_special_dialog
Tunable.description: If checked, UI will treat this as a special ok or ok/cancel dialog and represent the ok or ok/cancel options in a special way. They will use the text as a tooltip for ok or ok/cancel options and use particular icons for the buttons.

TunableTuple.description: A list of icons and labels to display in the UI dialog.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: label
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableVariant.name: secondary_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a secondary icon to be displayed. Only certain dialog types may support this field.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: The dialog's text.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: text_ok
Tunable.description: The OK button text.

TunableVariant.name: text_tokens
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define text tokens to be used to localized text.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the text tokens that are available to all text fields in the dialog, such as title, text, responses, default and initial text values, tooltips, etc.

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored "associated_club" on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

TunableTuple.name: career_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized string, number, or Sim, representing the specified career data for the specified participant.

TunableVariant.name: career_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's whose career data we care about.

TunableTuple.name: civic_policy
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the Civic Policy system.

TunableVariant.name: civic_policy_data
TunableVariant.description: The specific value to display.

TunableTuple.name: definition
TunableTuple.description: A catalog definition to use as a token. This is useful if you want to properly localize an object's name or description.

TunableTuple.name: game_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized number or Sim representing the specified game component data from game component.

TunableVariant.name: game_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's from whom the game component data we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: global_policy
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from the tuned global policy.

Tunable.name: global_policy
Tunable.description: The global policy from which data is displayed.

TunableEnum.name: token_property
TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a Lifestyle Brand owned by a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who owns the lifestyle brand.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the amount of Simoleons that were awarded in loot to the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we fetch the earned amount of money.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object marketplace component and marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_property
TunableTuple.description: The token is a property of a game object. This could be catalog properties like its price or its rarity which is a property given by a component.

TunableEnum.name: obj_property
TunableEnum.description: The property of the object that we will request.

TunableTuple.name: participant_count
TunableTuple.description: The number of participants of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: sickness
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableList.name: ui_responses
TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableList.name: end_of_gig_medal_to_display_data
TunableList.display: End Of Gig Medal To Display Data
TunableList.description: A map between career situation medal to display data used in the end of day dialog for the gig.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: Medal achieved in this gig.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Display data used in the end of day dialog for the medal.

TunableList.name: additional_icons
TunableList.description: Icons to show in the end of day dialog if achieved the medal.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: Icon to show in dialog.

Tunable.name: icon_text
Tunable.description: Description to use with icon.

TunableVariant.name: description_text
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, show this description text in the end of day dialog if get the medal.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_notification_icon_override
TunableVariant.display: End Of Gig Notification Icon Override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning an icon override for the primary icon used in the End Of Gig Notification. If this is disabled, the icon tuned on the career track will be used.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_notifications
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a notification to show at the end of the gig instead of a normal career message. Tokens are: * 0: The Sim owner of the career * 1: The level name (e.g. Chef) * 2: The career name (e.g. Culinary) * 3: The company name (e.g. Maids United) * 4: The pay for the gig * 5: The gratuity for the gig * 6: The customer (sim) of the gig, if there is a customer. * 7: A bullet list of loots and payments as a result of this gig. This list uses the text tuned on the loots themselves to create bullets for each loot. Those texts will generally have tokens 0 and 1 be the subject and target sims (of the loot) but may have additional tokens depending on the type of loot.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A map between the result type of the gig and the post-gig notification.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.name: expand_behavior
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

TunableEnum.name: information_level
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's information level.

TunableVariant.name: participant

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_overmax_notification
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, the notification that will be used if the sim gains an overmax level during this gig. Will override the overmax notification in career messages. The following tokens are provided: * 0: The Sim owner of the career * 1: The level name (e.g. Chef) * 2: The career name (e.g. Culinary) * 3: The company name (e.g. Maids United) * 4: The overmax level * 5: The pay for the gig * 6: Additional pay tuned at additional_pay_per_overmax_level * 7: The overmax rewards in a bullet-point list, in the form of a string. These are tuned on the career_track

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.name: expand_behavior
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

TunableEnum.name: information_level
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's information level.

TunableVariant.name: participant
TunableVariant.description: This field is deprecated. Please use 'icon' instead.

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableVariant.name: secondary_icon_response
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, associate a response to clicking the secondary icon.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The response associated to the secondary icon.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_overmax_rewardless_notification
TunableVariant.display: End Of Gig Overmax Rewardless Notification
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, the notification that will be used if the sim gains an overmax level with no reward during this gig. Will override the overmax rewardless notification in career messages.The following tokens are provided: * 0: The Sim owner of the career * 1: The level name (e.g. Chef) * 2: The career name (e.g. Culinary) * 3: The company name (e.g. Maids United) * 4: The overmax level * 5: The pay for the gig * 6: Additional pay tuned at additional_pay_per_overmax_level

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_promotion_text
TunableVariant.description: A string that, if enabled, will be pre-pended to the bullet list of results in the promotion notification. Tokens are: * 0 : The Sim owner of the career

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: follow_up_gig
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the current gig is successfully completed, the follow-up gig will be automatically set on the Sim when the current gig is removed. A couple things to note: - The scheduled time will be the time the follow-up gig is added to the Sim plus any prep time. - If the current gig has a customer, the follow-up gig will have the same customer.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The follow-up gig to push on the Sim.

TunableList.name: gig_cast
TunableList.description: This is the list of sims that need to spawn for this gig.

TunableTuple.description: Data for cast members. It contains a test which tests against the owner of this gig and spawn the necessary sims. A bit may be applied through the loot action to determine the type of cast members (costars, directors, etc...)

TunableVariant.name: cast_member_rel_bit
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, this rel bit will be applied on the spawned cast member.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Rel bit to apply.

Tunable.name: sim_filter
Tunable.description: If filter test is passed, this sim is created and stored.

TunableEnum.name: gig_cast_rel_bit_collection_id
TunableEnum.display: Gig Cast Rel Bit Collection Id
TunableEnum.description: If a rel bit is applied to the cast member, it must be of this collection id. We use this to clear the rel bit when the gig is over.

TunableVariant.name: gig_pay
TunableVariant.description: Base amount of pay for this gig. Can be either a flat amount or a range.

TunableTuple.name: flat_amount
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: gig_prep_tasks
TunableList.description: A list of prep tasks the Sim can do to improve their performance during the gig.

TunableTuple.description: Tuple containing the necessary data to display the progress of the prep task to the UI.

TunableList.name: linked_statistics
TunableList.description:
If specified, these are statistics whose value updates are linked to the specified statistic.
Value changes to the linked statistic are applied with the tuned multiplier to the statistic.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: Statistic that is tracked by this prep task.

Tunable.name: task_description
Tunable.description: A description of the prep task. {0.String} is the thresholded description.

Tunable.name: task_icon
Tunable.description: The icon to use in displaying the prep task.

TunableVariant.name: task_tooltip
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, tooltip will show up on the preptask.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A tooltip of the prep task.

TunableList.name: thresholded_descriptions
TunableList.description: A list of thresholds and the text describing it. The thresholded description will be largest threshold value in this list that the commodity is >= to.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: Description for meeting this threshold.

Tunable.name: threshold
Tunable.description: Threshold that the commodity must >= to.

TunableTuple.name: gig_prep_time
TunableTuple.description: The amount of time between when a gig is selected and when it occurs.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableTuple.name: gig_time
TunableTuple.description: A tunable schedule that will determine when you have to be at work.

TunableList.name: schedule_entries
TunableList.description: A list of event schedules. Each event is a mapping of days of the week to a start_time and duration.

TunableTuple.description: A schedule. Define availability for days of the week. For the set of specified days, define an hour of the day and a duration, in hours. Optionally, specified if the start time is random within the tuned window.

TunableTuple.name: days_available
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: Duration of this work session in hours.

Tunable.name: random_start
Tunable.description: If checked, this schedule will have a random start time in the tuned window each time.

TunableEnum.name: schedule_shift_type
TunableEnum.description: Shift Type for the schedule, this will be used for validations.

TunableTuple.name: start_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableVariant.name: initial_result_based_career_performance
TunableVariant.description: A mapping between the GigResult for this gig and the initial career performance for the Sim's first gig.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A map between the result type of the gig and the initial career performance the Sim will receive.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The GigResult enum that represents the outcome of the Gig.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The initial performance value that will be applied.

TunableList.name: loots_on_schedule
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply when a sim gets a gig.

TunableVariant.name: odd_job_tuning
TunableVariant.description: Tuning specific to odd jobs. Leave untuned if this gig is not an odd job.

Tunable.name: customer_description
Tunable.description: The description of the odd job written by the customer. Token 0 is the customer sim.

TunableVariant.name: gig_gratuity_bullet_point_text
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the gig gratuity will be a bullet point in the bullet pointed list of loots and money supplied to the end of gig notification (this is token 7 of that notification). If disabled, gratuity will be omitted from that list. Tokens: * 0: The sim owner of the career * 1: The customer * 2: the gratuity amount

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableList.name: result_based_gig_gratuity_chance_multipliers
TunableList.display: Result Based Gig Gratuity Chance Multipliers
TunableList.description: A set of multipliers for determining the gig gratuity chance (i.e., the probability the Sim will receive gratuity in addition to the base pay). The gratuity chance depends on the GigResult of the gig. This maps the result type of the gig and the gratuity chance/percentage. If this map (or a GigResult) is left untuned, then no gratuity is added.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The GigResult enum that represents the outcome of the Gig.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The multiplier to be calculated for this GigResult. This represents the percentage chance the Sim will receive gratuity. If the Sim is to not receive gratuity, the base value should be 0 (without further tests). If this Sim is guaranteed to receive gratuity, the base value should be 1 (without further tests).

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: result_based_gig_gratuity_multipliers
TunableList.description: A set of multipliers for the gig gratuity. This maps the result type of the gig and the gratuity multiplier (a percentage). The base pay will be multiplied by this multiplier in order to determine the actual gratuity amount.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The GigResult enum that represents the outcome of the Gig.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The gratuity multiplier to be calculated for this GigResult.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: use_customer_description_as_gig_description
Tunable.display: Use Customer Description As Gig Description
Tunable.description: If checked, the customer description will be used as the gig description. This description is used as the tooltip for the gig icon in the career panel.

Tunable.name: open_career_panel
Tunable.description: If set to true, the career panel will be opened when this gig is assigned.

TunableList.name: payout_stat_data
TunableList.description: Stats, and its associated information, that are gained (or lost) when sim finishes this gig.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: Stat for this payout.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Data about this payout stat.

Tunable.name: base_amount
Tunable.description: Base amount (pre-modifiers) applied to the sim at the end of the gig.

TunableList.name: medal_to_payout
TunableList.description: Mapping of medal -> stat multiplier.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: Medal achieved in this gig.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Mulitiplier on statistic payout if scorable situation ends with the associate medal.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: ui_threshold
TunableList.description: Thresholds and icons we use for this stat to display in the end of day dialog. Tune in reverse of highest threshold to lowest threshold.

TunableTuple.description: Threshold and icon for this stat and this gig.

Tunable.name: threshold
Tunable.description: Threshold that the stat must >= to.

Tunable.name: threshold_description
Tunable.description: Description to use with icon

Tunable.name: threshold_icon
Tunable.description: Icon if the stat is of this threshold.

TunableVariant.name: result_based_career_performance
TunableVariant.description: A mapping between the GigResult for this gig and the change in career performance for the sim.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A map between the result type of the gig and the career performance the sim will receive.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The GigResult enum that represents the outcome of the Gig.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The performance modification.

TunableVariant.name: result_based_career_performance_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: A mapping between the GigResult and the multiplier for the career performance awarded.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A map between the result type of the gig and the career performance multiplier.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The GigResult enum that represents the outcome of the Gig.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The performance modification multiplier.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: result_based_gig_pay_multipliers
TunableVariant.description: A set of multipliers for gig pay. The multiplier used depends on the GigResult of the gig. The meanings of each GigResult may vary by gig type.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A map between the result type of the gig and the additional pay the sim will receive.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a total multiplier value based on tunable tests.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: result_based_loots
TunableVariant.description: A mapping between the GigResult for this gig and a loot list to optionally apply. The resolver for this loot list is either a SingleSimResolver of the working sim or a DoubleSimResolver with the target being the customer if there is a customer sim.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A map between the result type of the gig and the loot list.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply.

Tunable.description: The loot action applied.

TunableVariant.name: tip
TunableVariant.description: A tip that is displayed with the gig in pickers and in the career panel. Can produce something like "Required Skill: Fitness 2".

TunableVariant.name: tip_icon
TunableVariant.description: An icon to show along with the tip.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: An icon to show along with the tip.

Tunable.name: tip_text
Tunable.description: The text string of the tip. Could be something like "Fitness 2".

Tunable.name: tip_title
Tunable.description: The title string of the tip. Could be something like "Required Skill.
